Legal_Issue: Whether free distribution of booklets and leaflets constitutes use of the trademark 'Cordon Bleu' in the normal course of trade under s. 4(1) of the Trade-Marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: No evidence of sales or commercial transactions involving the distributed materials
Burden_of_Proof: On appellant to demonstrate trademark use in the normal course of trade
Legal_Rule: A trademark is deemed used if marked on wares or associated with them during transfer in the normal course of trade
Standard_of_Review: Statutory interpretation and application of s. 4(1) of the Trade-Marks Act
Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency of evidence submitted on appeal
Grounds_for_Claim: Appellant claimed free distribution constituted commercial use of the trademark
Outcome_on_Merits: Trademark not used in normal course of trade; registration properly canceled
Review_Standard: Application of statutory criteria for trademark use
Key_Evidence_Considered: Free distribution of 'Cordon Bleu' booklets and leaflets without sale or transfer of property
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging Registrar's strike-out of trademark registration for non-use
Court_Result: Dismissed appeal; upheld cancellation of registration
Defendant_Response: Registrar maintained that no commercial use was demonstrated
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, affirmed by Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to demonstrate use in the normal course of trade
Applicable_Process: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: s. 4(1) of the Trade-Marks Act regarding trademark use
